brief_summary.textblock:
To establish the overall agreement of the MassPLEX Factor II and Factor V Leiden Genotyping
      Test with bi-directional DNA sequencing for Factor II and Factor V Leiden.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determination of Performance Characteristics of the MassPLEX Factor II/V Leiden Test

detailed_description.textblock:
De-identified banked genomic DNA samples derived from whole blood from subjects with
      suspected thrombophilia will be collected from one or more clinical sites.  Three clinical
      laboratory sites will analyze the samples with the FII/FVL Test.  Bi-directional DNA
      sequencing will be performed on all samples at an independent core reference laboratory.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  suspected thrombophilia

          -  18 years of age or older

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Clinical Study to Determine the Performance Characteristics of the MassPLEX Factor II and Factor V Leiden Genotyping Test in Patients With Suspected Thrombophilia

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Overall percent agreement of the FII/FVL Test results to the bi-directional DNA sequencing results.
primary_outcome.measure: Performance of the MassPLEX Factor II/V Leiden Test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples are collected at time of suspected thrombotic event.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Retrospective
